Rich,
Kofun period tsuba come up at auction from time to time.  The Compton=
 and Lundgren sales come to mind.  I have two. There was a small iron hoju =
guard for sale at a show in the states a few years ago.  Of course you can =
see plenty of them in Japanese museums and books on the period.

The corros=
ion pattern on that tsuba isn't consistent with the pieces I've seen.  The =
rim is deeply eroded, but the other edges and the surface are in great shap=
e with no distortion.  Not sure if Tom was joking, but I wouldn't be surpri=
sed if he's right.

Jim



  http://page8.auctions.yahoo.co.jp/jp/auction/h=
19401221

  authentic ?, I often wonder how frequently old tsuba such as Ho=
ju and 
  T=F4ran Kei are seen.

  RIch
